channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A 13,600-year-old mastodon skull is unearthed in an Iowa creek
item.description: The University of Iowa’s Office of the State Archaeologist said a 12-day excavation yielded “several mastodon bones,” primarily from the skull. Mastodons are distant cousins of elephants.
item.content:encoded: The University of Iowa’s Office of the State Archaeologist said a 12-day excavation yielded “several mastodon bones,” primarily from the skull. Mastodons are distant cousins of elephants.
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Looking ahead to the DNC, the Harris-Walz campaign prepares for a defining moment
item.description:
The state of the presidential race is a far cry from what it was just a few months ago. Vice President Kamala Harris's rise to the top of the Democratic ticket has sparked waves of excitement, and some tension, among democratic leaders and voters across the country.

Thousands of delegates now head to Chicago for the party's convention this week, where Harris is expected to deliver the biggest speech of her political career to date.

NPR's Adrian Ma speaker with co-host Ari Shapiro, about how this moment couple shape her campaign to the nation.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
item.content:encoded:
The state of the presidential race is a far cry from what it was just a few months ago. Vice President Kamala Harris's rise to the top of the Democratic ticket has sparked waves of excitement, and some tension, among democratic leaders and voters across the country.

Thousands of delegates now head to Chicago for the party's convention this week, where Harris is expected to deliver the biggest speech of her political career to date.

NPR's Adrian Ma speaker with co-host Ari Shapiro, about how this moment couple shape her campaign to the nation.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

(Image credit: ANDREW CABALLERO-REYNOLDS)

item.title: Feeling groggy? Life Kit has tips for optimal napping
item.description: Ever wake up from a nap feeling extra groggy? Naps can be beneficial for your mental and physical health, but there's a few things you need to know. NPR's Life Kit has tips for the optimal nap.
item.content:encoded: Ever wake up from a nap feeling extra groggy? Naps can be beneficial for your mental and physical health, but there's a few things you need to know. NPR's Life Kit has tips for the optimal nap.
item.dc:creator: Andee Tagle

item.title: Should a President have total control over the Fed? Harris and Trump disagree
item.description: Should a President have total control over the Fed? Both candidates vying for the presidency have differing points of view.
item.content:encoded: Should a President have total control over the Fed? Both candidates vying for the presidency have differing points of view.
item.dc:creator: Wailin Wong

item.title: Excitement and tension ahead of this week's DNC
item.description: There's excitement and tension among Democrats as thousands of delegates head to Chicago for the party's convention this week.
item.content:encoded: There's excitement and tension among Democrats as thousands of delegates head to Chicago for the party's convention this week.
item.dc:creator: Adrian Ma

item.title: The Democratic National Convention starts Monday in Chicago. Here's how to watch
item.description: NPR will be reporting live from the convention in Chicago, including live updates online, live video each night and live special coverage on air and on video Wednesday and Thursday night.
item.content:encoded:
NPR will be reporting live from the convention in Chicago, including live updates online, live video each night and live special coverage on air and on video Wednesday and Thursday night.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Emily Alfin Johnson

item.title: A red flag for the 2026 World Cup: Fans might not get U.S. visas in time
item.description: Many fans are dreaming of coming to the U.S. for the World Cup in 2026. One major problem looms: Wait times to get visas can be absurdly long
item.content:encoded: Many fans are dreaming of coming to the U.S. for the World Cup in 2026. One major problem looms: Wait times to get visas can be absurdly long
item.dc:creator: Rafael Nam

item.title: Harris and Walz campaign in Pennsylvania ahead of Democratic Convention
item.description: The state is a key battleground in the November election.
item.content:encoded:
The state is a key battleground in the November election.

(Image credit: Julia Nikhinson)
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: A statue honoring John Lewis will replace a former Confederate monument in Georgia
item.description: The 16-foot-tall sculpture of the civil rights icon will be officially unveiled later this week. It replaces a 30-foot-tall obelisk erected by the Daughters of the Confederacy in 1908.
item.content:encoded:
The 16-foot-tall sculpture of the civil rights icon will be officially unveiled later this week. It replaces a 30-foot-tall obelisk erected by the Daughters of the Confederacy in 1908.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Where the law stands 30 years after a woman sued McDonald's for spilling hot coffee
item.description: NPR's David Folkenflik talks with Catherine Sharkey about the 30th anniversary of the McDonald's hot coffee lawsuit decision and its legacy.
item.content:encoded: NPR's David Folkenflik talks with Catherine Sharkey about the 30th anniversary of the McDonald's hot coffee lawsuit decision and its legacy.
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik
